reviewText: Actually, I bought this & I thought it would be pretty good, it is. But, she's too fake. Her performances are the same thing as listening to the cd cause all she ever does is lip synch. That gets really irritating after a while, we all know she is doing it, she doesn't seem to know that we already know. The only performances worth watching are Breathe On Me(cause it's so hot) & Everytime(which is very beautiful). The whole performance is very sexual. What I do like is the making of the video Toxic, I never really understood it, or paid much attention to the plot of it, but after seeing that, I find the plot very smart & creative. The two performances on TRL are incase you missed it when it was on tv, seeming as not everyone lives in the US, like me, Canadian, I never got the chance to see it. More lip synching, but it got me to like (I got that)Boom Boom, those rappers(Ying Yang Twins) are so fun, & Britney is just hot. I like the fact that she included her two latest videos, though I would have waited till after to include all her latest videos, but that's just me. The cd, the 4 songs aren't too bad actually, I love the Toxic remix. I'm clearly not a Britney hater, I'm just a little disappointed with her efforts, & I'm getting tired of her lip synching every song. I prefer Christina, cause at least she's the real thing, Britney is giving us joke performances. I like Britney, but start singing, it's what the fans want!!

reviewText: Being the massive Britney Spears fan that I am, I knew straight away that I had to own this DVD. It was just released in the UK two days ago, and I bought it on the day it was released, which was also two days after one of the greatest nights of my life. You see, on Saturday May 1st 2004 I travelled to Manchester in England to see Britney Spears live on part of her Onyx Hotel Tour that is currently sweeping the world! My voice is gradually returning, but losing it (along with my head) was worth it just to see her up close! Currently on a Spears-high, this DVD was my most essential purchase for quite a few weeks, and I am very happy with it, not only because it contains so many brilliant features, but because it is a perfect addition to any true fans' collection!People have complained that all the material on this DVD has already been on TV countless times before, but not everyone lives in America (I don't), so most of the stuff on here was new to me. The DVD cover is the same as the multi-platinum No.1 album "In The Zone," and this instantly makes the two sort of companions to each other. The first feature on the DVD is probably the best of the lot. It's the ABC Television Special - "Britney Spears: In The Zone" which was broadcast across America on the eve of the release of Britney's fourth album. In an intimate setting Britney performs to some of her biggest fans. She sings "Toxic," "Breathe On Me," "Boys/I'm A Slave 4 U," "(I Got That) Boom Boom," "Everytime," "...Baby One More Time" and "Me Against The Music." Seven great songs there, seven great performances. Woven in-between these performances are some brilliant clips of Britney during the recording process of the album. The best one for me is where Britney is in a Taxi and feeling free for the first time in a while - you can see tears in her eyes too. Very sweet!After this fantastic feature, we move on to MTV's "Spankin New Music Week On TRL" Times Square Performance. This is yet another brilliant feature because we get to see one of Britney's first public performances of 2003 after her year-long hiatus. She sings "Me Against The Music" and "(I Got That) Boom Boom" featuring Ying Yang Twins Live. Both performances are brilliant and her pants are so cool! And her hat! After this, we move onto the full-length video to "Me Against The Music" featuring Madonna. This really is one of Britney's greatest music videos to date and was very pricey too! Two icons duetting on one spectacular, dance-tastic smash hit is a feast for the eyes! Everyone has seen this video a million times, though!We then move onto a really cool feature, which is MTV's "Making The Video" for "Toxic." This has been shown before, but it's nice to finally own it for yourself. We see the brilliant production of Britney's true comeback song and we also see a really funny and charismatic superstar at the centre. The best bits are when Britney watches her old "Making The Video" series from years past, and when she breaks the plunger that she uses to climb up the wall, especially when she claims, "I am SO strong!" She's so sweet. Then of course we get the full video to "Toxic," which is absolutely spectacular! If this doesn't win multiple VMA's in August/September later on this year, there's something wrong! This is the song that has rightfully put Britney back on top in 2004 as the world's biggest superstar! A massive No.1 all over the world and one of the biggest radio hits of the past year has made this already an anthemic, classic pop tune. We then get "In The Personal Zone" which is a fantastic documentary in which Britney reveals all on Inspiration, Spirituality, ABC Special, Onyx Hotel Tour, TRL Performance and Toxic. We also get a really sexy photo gallery of Britney!Also includes along with this DVD is a four-track Bonus CD. I have the UK Region 2 DVD version of this, so the two main songs I have are "I've Just Begun (Having My Fun)" and "Girls And Boys." However, as an American purchaser you get "The Answer" and "Don't Hang Up," which are two brilliant songs (the former R'n'B, the latter Dance) that feature on my version of the In The Zone album! Very confusing indeed, but there's also two fantastic remixes included! These are "Toxic (Lenny Bertoldo's Radio Mix)" and "Me Against The Music (Bloodshy & Avant's Chix Mix)." I personally prefer the Toxic remix, but the remix of Me Against The Music isn't bad either!OVERALL GRADE: 10/10In the past we've received some brilliant Britney Spears DVD's. We've had "Time Out With Britney" and "Live And More!" which were both superb. We then had the rather disappointing "Britney: The Videos," followed by the amazing "Britney Spears: Live From Las Vegas" and "Crossroads." Of course, there was the brilliant DVD included with the book Stages that followed Britney around on the Mexican leg of her Dream Within A Dream Tour of 2002. I have to say though, that "In The Zone" is the best DVD/video that Britney has released to date! I suggest that if you're a big Britney fan you buy this straight away, you won't regret it!
summary: Britney Still Rules And This DVD Proves It!

reviewText: Britney Spears has reigned supreme as pop music's No. 1 female entertainer since her Grammy-nominated, history-making first single "...Baby One More Time" (1998).  She has defined a generation and has become the epitome of what is Top 40 pop: music that is enjoyable to listen to, period.  Her fourth studio release In the Zone (2003) coincided with the DVD release here, including less raunchy but still uber-sexy performances of her Grammy-winning song "Toxic," a sweaty girl-girl-tinged version of "Breathe on Me," pant and dance-heavy "Slave 4 U" and more.  Between footage shot in NYC in June 2003 are interviews and insights on Britney's life, from Family to Life in the Public Eye.  DVD bonuses include two live performances of "Me Against the Music" and "Boom, Boom" on TRL and an entertaining Making the Video for the scorcher "Toxic."  In the end, viewers are sure to be left wanting more, but Zone satisfies nonetheless.  Good job here.
summary: Britney's in the zone. R u?

reviewText: I got this one simply because of the TOXIC music video.  That videos is the best one Britney has done in recent memory.  TOXIC is one of those songs that grows on you...and this video really helps!  Another highlight of this DVD are the TRL performances "Me Against The Music" and "(I Got That) Boom Boom" from last November.  Also, the "Me Against The Music" video is great as well!  The rest of the DVD is filled with specials, video documentaries, and such.  The bonus CD contains the two songs included on her international release of IN THE ZONE...plus two remixes.  So far, the CD is sounding pretty good...(listening to it right now).  For my first Britney Spears DVD-related purchase, this is a great package...go ahead and treat yourself.  Britney is slowly evolving as a person and an artist....to find out more...go out and pick this up today!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am a Britney fan, and I have Britney Live in Las Vegas, and Britney Spears Live and More! as well as this latest dvd....While this one is good and very enjoyable, she continues her streak of non-singing, which to some is a turn-off in a dvd, or a plus b/c you can hear the words, and it is clear. Anyway, I prefer live singing on dvd, at least it makes you feel like you are at the concert!The dvd itself is pretty good. If I had to rank the dvds in order, this one would fit second behind Live and More...This dvd has both videos out at that time (MATM and Toxic) Making the Video:Toxic, 2 MTV performances (MATM, Boom Boom) and the ABC concert special, intermitent with Britney talking clips, like on live and more...there are also extras, like a photo gallery, and the free bonus cd of mixes and a few new songs!Over all, for around $10-15 this is a pretty good deal, and a fun dvd, but sometimes the non singing weirds you out, honestly!
summary: This dvd is OK, depending on what you like...

reviewText: First of all I have to admit that I never thought that I was gonna buy a Britney DVD. I liked some of her songs and found her pretty and all that but nothing more, but when "Me against the music" came out, I simply found it excellent. So I bought the cd and then this DVD.This DVD contains the videos "Me against the music" (feat. Madonna) and "Toxic", which to me is Britney's best song and video. The rhythm is perfect. Besides the videos you can find: "Toxic, making the video", Mtv's special performances, making the album "In the zone" and an ABC special. And finally besides the DVD you can get a bonus CD containing few songs and remixes.You won't be sorry with this DVD even though you're not a Britney's fan. I can say this because it happened to me.

reviewText: I love this dvd. I was definitely impressed with all that you get in this dvd, and for such a small price. You may remember the previous Britney DVD, "THE VIDEOS." That one was horrible. It came with 3 videos, only one that i like. (I'm a slave 4 u.) The others were "don't let me be the last to know, and Not a girl, not yet a woman." It had one good performance from the mtv awards, and then two comercials. Her pepsi commercial and her 15 second promo for her Las Vegas show. That dvd was pathetic, but this one definitely makes up for it. She does two great performances from MTV's TRL. The entire ABC special which includes interviews, as well as seven hot performances from her and her hot dancers. Then u get the entire MTV's making the video from Toxic. Then you get two of her videos which are the fan's favorite. And then you get a 4 track cd with the dvd. It includes 2 previously non released songs and 2 remixes to the songs Me against the Music and Toxic. I love the song "The Answer", which is a P Diddy produced track that can easily be a single. So go get this dvd, i guarantee you will be satisfied.

reviewText: Nope - she's not the greatest singer in the world, but she puts on one helluva show.  Up until "In the Zone," the only thing I liked about Britney was her video for Stronger.  Then she came out with I'm A Slave for You (granted, the Vanity 6 hook caught my attention), and I knew that her next endeavor would be worth purchasing.  And it was.  So now we are at the DVD.  I watched that ABC Special and was elated to see it included on the DVD.  Teaming up with Madonna on Me Against the Music was brilliant and you gotta be comatose not to like the video for Toxic.  All included here.  What makes a good DVD are the extras.  Well, the extra CD is well worth the remixes found on it.  It's time to give Britney a chance.  It's not like she's going anywhere.

reviewText: If there is anything that is a perfect testament to the fact that the American public has a devastatingly low IQ average, it is the fact that anyone would buy this or any other releases by Britney Spears. When her new single "Everytime," a song she "wrote", comes up on the radio, young girls gush "Listen! It's her song for Justin!!!!! Oh my Gaaawwwwwd!!!!". Meanwhile, do they even have a large enough attention span to realize that "Everytime" is from "In The Zone," an album that came out last November, and that she has been married and divorced since? Even more irksome is the fact that 'Everytime' is not even a word. The correct way to say that is: 'Every Time'. Look up 'Everytime' in the dictionary; it is not there. Indeed, it is two words, not one. Is that really that hard to understand, Britney?This trash only further testifies to the fact that people in the entertainment industry abuse their power and manipulate the general public. The fact that she has put a song on the radio to make people think she actually cares about Justin Timberlake when in fact she quite obviously is just trying to stir up hype and grab attention and record sales, and that people actually buy it is pitiful.I give her an extra star after the mandatory 1 star for two reasons. Firstly, she is an excellent dancer, and that fact I can't dispute, and secondly, she has successfully duped the American public. Although not the hardest feat, it is far from the easiest...at least one still has reason to hope so.
summary: Why Would Anybody Buy This Trash?
